titles.title: Gädlä Kiros “Vita of Kiros” / Mälkǝʾa Kiros “Image of Kiros” (II) / Mälkǝʾa Kiros “Image of Kiros” (III)

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä Kiros (fols. 5ra-43rb) II) Mälkǝʾa Kiros (II) (fols. 43va-50va) III) Mälkǝʾa Kiros (III) (fols. 50vb-51va)
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: The book was probably donated by priest Kahsay Ḥadära (s. Additio 2). Gädlä Kiros (fol. 34vb) and Mälkǝʾa Kiros (II) (fol. 51va) contain a supplication prayer for ʾabunä Gäbrä ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer. The remaining supplication formulas have a blank space to accomodate a name.

owners.owner: Originally, the Ms. was in possession of ʾaläqa Bǝzuʾayyäh Täwäldä Mädhǝn who sold it to priest Kahsay Ḥadära (s. Additio 2).

dcomments.dcomment: The Ms. was sold during the reign of Haylä Śǝllase on 29 Yäkkatit 1957 A.M. (= 8th March, 1965 A.D.) (s. Additio 2).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, criss-cross, double crescent).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Folded (not braided) pieces of leather are used for the headband and tailband.

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – ፪II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – ፫III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – ፬IV(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 4; 5 stub after 3/fols. 29r-36v) – ፭V(8/fols. 37r-44v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) – B(3; s.l.: 2, stub after 2/fols. 53r-55v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; name of the original owner (?); groups of lines (alternating with black lines) in the incipit page of Texts I-III; two lines of text (fols. 9va, 10vb, 14vb; reflecting the former text division?); the word hale luya (fol. 23rb); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Some words are half rubricated with the first letter(s) written in black ink (e.g., fols. 16va, 21ra, etc.).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ለዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ (fols.: 5ra, 16rb, 34vb, 43rb) ዓ፡ for ዓለም፡ (fols. 5ra, 43ra) ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ (fol. 36rb, 37rb) ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ (fol. 51rab)

desccontent.mss: VatLib Comb. 205 (19th/20th cent.), fols. 5r-80r: “Atti di Kiros”; fols. 80v-83v: “Effigie di Kiros” (RaiCombAeth 201-02, no. 205), BerPrKult orient. Oct. 1288 (17th/18th cent.?), fols. 2ra-31ra: “Vita des seligen und heiligen Abbā Kiros” (HamSixBerl 135-36, no. 60), VatLib Comb 206 (20th cent.), fols. 4r-93r: “Atti di Kiros” (RaiCombAeth 202-03, no. 206), BritLib Orient. 701 (18th cent.), fols. 2a-53a: “The Acts of Cyrus”, fol. 53b-54: Hymn to Kiros (WrBriMus 184ab, no. CCLXXVII), BerPrKult Ṭānāsee 143 – Dāgā Esṭifānos 32 (16th cent.), fols. 1ra-74vb (?) (SixTana III, 165-166, no. 32), EMML no. 3554 (16th/17th cent., Church of Masāqo Śellāsē, Ḥarr Ambā, Ankobarr, Shoa), fols. 1r-38v (EMML IX, 37), EMML no. 319 (19th cent., Private library of Mamrē Baqala, district of Gafarsā, Addis Ababa), fols. 1r-50v (EMML II, 21), EMML no. 2107 (19th cent., Church of Miṭāq Takla Hāymānot, Tagulat and Bulgā, Shoa), I fols. 67r-96v: “Gadla Abbā Kiros”; II fol. 96r-98v: Mälkǝʾa Kiros (EMML VI, 199), EMML no. 2137 (19th cent., Church of Miṭāq Takla Hāymānot, Tagulat and Bulgā, Shoa), fols. 1r-32v (EMML VI, 248), EMML no. 3418 (19th/20th cent., Church of Karrayyo Takla Hāymānot, Gubbālāfto, Yağğu, Wallo), I fols. 51r-65v: “Combat of Abbā Kiros”; II fol. 65v: “Sälam” to the saint (EMML VIII, 252), EMML no. 4683 (19th cent., Private library of Qēs Bakwra, Dabra Berhān, Shoa), fols. 1r-38r (EMML X, 266).

literature.text: BS III, 1344. CE VII, 2083. EAE III, “Kiros”. P. MARRASSINI, “Il Gadla Kiros”, in: V. Böll et al. (eds.) Studia Aethiopica. In Honour of Siegbert Uhlig on the Occassion of his 65th birthday, Wiesbaden, 2004, 79-90. ID, “ʻThe Egyptian Saintsʼ of the Abyssinian Hagiography”, Aethiopica 8, 2005,112-29.

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 5rab:በስመ፡”… ንቀድም፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ንጽሕፍ፡ እንከ፡ ገድለ፡ ፃማሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ወብፁዕ፡ አባ፡ ኪሮስ፨ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ዓመቱ፡ ለዓ፡ ዓ፧ ወነበረ፡ በመንበረ፡ አቡሁ፡ ዮናኦን፨ ወገብረ፡ ምግባራተ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወኢያንተገ፡ እምኔሁ፨ ወነበረ፡ ፷ዓመተ፡ ወወለደ፡ ወልዱ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዓብያ፡ ወአዕረፈ፡ በክብር፡ ወነበረ፡ ዓብያ፡ ዲበ፡ መንበረ፡ አቡሁ፨ ወገብረ፡ ምግባራተ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወኢያንተገ፡ እምኔሁ፡ ወአሐተኒ፡ ወስማ፡ ለብእሲቱ፡ ኒናሳራ፡ ወነበረት፡ መካን፡ ፴ዓመተ፨ ወእምዝ፡ ጸለዩ፡ኅቡረ፡ ኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወፀንሰት፡ በጊዜ ፶፡ወወለደት፡ መንታ፨
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 5rab: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. We shall begin with the help of God, we shall write the ascetic life of the holy and blessed father Kiros. Let his prayer and blessing be with his maid, for ever and ever, Amen. And there was on the throne of his father Yonaˀon. And he did the deeds of his father and did not abandon that (duty); and he ruled for 60 years; and he begat a son whose name was ˁAbya. And he died in glory and ˁAbya (sat) on the throne of his father. And he did the deeds of his father and did not abandon that not even once. And the name of his wife (was) Ninasara. And she was infertile for 30 years. And thereafter they prayed together to God and she conceived when (she was) forty and she gave birth to twins.
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 33ra: ወእምዝ፡መጽኡ᎓ ቅዱሳን᎓ ወተመጠዉ᎓ ምሥጢረ᎓ ቅዱሳት᎓ አባ᎓ ባውሚን᎓ ወበብኑዳ᎓ አባ᎓ ሰሞዖን᎓ ወአባ᎓ አሞይ᎓ ወአባ᎓ ኢላርዮን᎓ ወአባ᎓ አውናፍር᎓ ወአባ᎓ ለትፁን᎓ ወአባ᎓ ፋውሊ᎓ ምስለ᎓ ኵሎሙ᎓ ነቢያት᎓ ወሐዋርያት፨ ጻድቃን᎓ ወሰማዕት᎓ ወምስለ᎓ ኵሎሙ᎓ መላእክት᎓ ንጹሐን᎓ ወበእደዊሁ᎓ ለመድኅን᎓ ጸሎቶሙ፡ ወስዕለቶሙ፡ ወትንብልናሆሙ᎓ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብሩሮሙ፡ ለዓ፡ አሜን፨
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 33ra: And thereafter came saints and they received the sacraments, father Bawmin and Bäbnuda, father Sämˁon and father Amoy and father Ilarion and father Awnafər and father Lätṣun and father Fauli with all prophets and apostles. The righteous and martyrs and with all angels and the pure and what is in hands of the Saviour, let their prayer and their entreaty and their intercession be with their servants, for ever and ever, Amen.
desccontent.details: Marrassini (2004:79-81) refers to this version of the Vita of Kiros as the text of “type 1”, most commonly spread and contained in many Mss. It is different from the Vita of “type 2” which is attested in a few Mss. only (translated and published: B. Turaev, “Kopto-efiopskoe skazanie o prepodobnom Kire”, Zapiski vostočnago otdelenija I.R.Arhe­ologičeskago Obščestva 15, 1903, 1–14). Marrassini (2004:83) distinguishes two kinds of type 1 Vita of Kiros: “long” and “short”. The implicit of DMD-013 is even shorter in comparison to the “short” version. The explicit of DMD-013 is similar to Ms. Comb. 205 and the last part of the explicit (beginning form: ወተመጠዉ᎓ ምሥጢረ᎓ ቅዱሳት) appears in Ms. Comb 206.

desccontent.mss: BritLib Orient. 12810 (18th centr.), fols. 52v-54r: “Sälam to Kiros” (StrBritLib 72, no. 42) VatLib Comb 205 (19th/20th cent.), fols. 5r-80r: “Atti di Kiros”; fols. 80v-83v: “Effigie di Kiros” (RaiCombAeth 201-02, no. 205) BaySB Cod. Aeth. 49 (18th centr. ?), fols. 38ra-41ra: “Salām an Kiros”; fols. 41ra-va: “Salām an Kiros” (SixBay 83, no. 49) EMIP 20 – Marwick Codex 16 (reign of Iyyo’as, 1747-1761), fols. 95v-102r (DelEP I, 60) EMIP 42 – Eliza Codex 17 (18th centr.), fols. 28v-29v (DelEP I, 120)
desccontent.incipit: Fols. 43va: ሰላም፡ ሰላም፡ እንዘ፡ አቀድም፡ አኵቶቶ [sic!]᎓᎓ ለአምላክ፡ ለስምከ፡ ዘአፍቀራ፨ ወለጽድቅከ[l.n.]፡ ዘሰምራ፨ ውዳሴከ፡ መልክእከ፡ አነብብ፡ ወዘዕበይከ፡ ነከራ፤ ጸግወኒ፡ ኪሮሰ[sic!]፡ ሀብተ፡ ጽድቅ፡ ዘኢይትአተት፡ ለግሙራ፨ መንፈሰ፡ ሰብሖ፡ ዘሱቱኤል፡ ዕዝራ፨
desccontent.itranslation:
Fols. 43va: Salutation, salutation while I am beginning the praise of God,

Who loved your name, and who was delighted by your righteousness (?).
I shall recite the praise of your image and the miracle of your greatness,

Kiros, donate me the treasure of righteousness which shall never go away, Extol the spirit of Ezra Sutuˀel.
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 51va: ዳዊት፡ ሐለየ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ በመሰንቆ፡ ሐዋዝ፡ መዝሙር፨ ለብእሲ፡ ጻድቅ፡ ሞቱ፡ ክቡር፨
desccontent.etranslation: Fol.51va: David sang a sweet psalm, with the harp, while saying: “Precious in the sight of the Lord [is] the death of his saints” (Ps. 115:15).

desccontent.mss: BritLib Orient. 12810 (18th cent.), fols. 52v-54r: “Sälam to Kiros”(StrBritLib 72, no. 42) EMML no. 2096-34 (17th cent.), fol. 152a (EMML VI, 176-184esp. 180) VatLib Aeth. 142 (17th cent.), fol. 101v: Invocatio, seu salām, s. Cyri (GréTisVat, 552-560, esp. 558)
desccontent.incipit: Fols. 50vb: ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ በእንቲአከ፡ ተብህለ᎓᎓ እመድሎተ፡ ሰማይ፡ ወምድር፨ ይፈደፍድ፡ ጥቀ፡ ዘእግርከ፡ ጽፍር፨ ኪሮስ፡ ምሉዓ፡ ምክር፨
desccontent.itranslation:
Fols. 50vb: Salutation to you! It was said about you:
(Only one of) your toenail(s) greatly exeeds the weight of the (entire) sky and earth,

O Kiros, full of wisdom!
desccontent.explicit: Fols. 51va: ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ ነፍሳቲነ፡ ኪሮስ፡ አማኅፀናከ፨ በበይነ፡ ዘተጸጎከ፡ ኪዳነ፨ ለሰሚዓ፡ ገድልከ፡ ዘተጋባዕነ፨ ከመ፡ ርግብ፡ ክንፈከ፡ ክድነነ፨ ኦ፡ አምላከ፡ ኪሮስ፡ አድኅኖ፡ እመከራ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ገበረ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ወአሜን፡ ለይኩን፡ ለይኩን፨ ፨
desccontent.etranslation:
Fols. 51va: Salutation to you! Kiros,

we have entrusted our souls to you, since you were granted the covenant.

Us, who have assembled to listen to your Vita,
Cover us with your wings like a dove.

O, God of Kiros, save our father Gäbrä ˀƎgziˀabəḥer fromsuffering of flesh and soul, for ever and ever. Amen, and Amen, so be it, so be it.

additional.add: Fol. 51vb: ነዓ፡ ኀቤየ፡ እንዘ፡ ታተሉ[sic!]፡ ሊቃናተ፨ ከመ፡ ትፈጽም፡ ኵሎ፡ ዘልቡናየ፡ ተምኔተ፨ ቅዱስ፡ ሩፋኤል፡ እንተ፡ ትስዕል፡ ምሕረተ፨ ለሰብዕ፡ ወለዕንስሳ፡ ፈታሔ፡ ማኅጸኖሙ፡ አንተ፨ ወጸላሎትከ፡ ያነሥእ፡ ዘሞተ፨
additional.tran:
Fol. 51vb: Come to me, being followed by the elders,
To fulfill all desires of my mind.
While entreating the mercy of St. Raphael,
You are the opener of  wombs of men and animals,

And your shade raises the dead.

additional.add:
Fol. 54r: የካቲት፡ ፳፱፡ ቀን፡ ፶፯ዓ.፡ ምሕረት፡

እኔ፡ አለቃ፡ ብዙአየሁ፡ ተወልደ፡ መድኅን፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ገድለ፡ አቡነ፡ ኪሮስ፡ በሰላሣ፡ ብር፡ ለቄስ፡ ካህሣይ፡ ሐደራ፡ ሸጮላቸው፡ አለሁ፡

መሸጠን፡ በጽሕፈት፡ ፌርማይ፡ አረጋግጣሉህ፡

ለዚሁ፡ መድን፡ አቶ፡ አጽብሐ፡ ዑዳር፡ ናቸው፡

እኔ፡ አቶ፡ አጽብሐ፡ ዑዳር፡ ከላይ፡ የተጠቀሰ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ መድን፡ ነኝ፡ ኃይለ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ይሙት፡

መድን፡ ለዚሁ፡ የነበሩ፡ አማኞች፡

1ኛ አባ፡ ኃይለ[l.n.]፡ ማርያም፡ ሐጎስ፡

2ኛ አለቃ፡ ለምለም፡ ተስፋ፡ ሕይወት፡

3ኛ ፌርማ፡ ናቸው፡

አለቃ ብዙአየሁ ተ/መድህን
additional.tran:
Fol. 54r: (On) 29 day (of the month) Yäkkatit 57 year of mercy, I, ˀaläqa  Bəzuˀayyähu Täwäldä Mädḫən have sold the book “Vita of Our Father Kiros” for thirty Bərr to qes Kahśay Ḥadära. I confirm my selling by writing my signature.

For this the guarantor is ˀato ˀAṣbəḥa ˁUdar
 I, ˀato ˀAṣbəḥa ˁUdar, am the guarantor of the book mentioned above. (I swear; otherwise) may die Haylä Śəllase!
The witnesses who were guarantors for that are
1st ˀabba Haylä(?) Maryam Ḥagos
2nd ˀaläqa Lämläm Täsfa Ḥəywät
3rd the one who signs

ˀaläqa Bəzuˀayyähu Tä/Mädhən.

extras.extra: - Stamp (of the church?): fol. 4r. - Notes and corrections in pencil or pen: fols. 11r, 29r, 35v, 43r, 47rb. - Underlined some words within Text I, referring to the Qal Kidan (the word is written in pen above the lines): fols. 16v, 26v, 36r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks are written in the middle of the upper margin of fols. 13r, 21r, 29r, 37r, 45r.

frames.frame: Fol. 5r (incipit page of Text I): elaborated, uncoloured (black outline) ornamental band with one pair of ailes and two lateral pendants; interlaces, geometric motifs.
